chapters.title: A Fatal Five-Star Review
chapters.summary: Elara Vance, former forensic chef turned innkeeper, serves her signature blueberry-lavender duck to her exacting boss, renowned critic Margot Finch. Hours later, Margot is found dead in her suite.
key_events: Elara prepares a perfect welcome dinner for Margot at the Blueberry Inn.
Margot, notoriously harsh, surprisingly praises the meal.
Elara discovers Margot's body, noting a faint, bitter almond scent on her lips.
The local sheriff, an old friend, arrives and immediately eyes Elara's kitchen.
Margot's assistant reveals the critic was finalizing a damning memoir.
chapters.ending_hook: The sheriff finds a vial of cyanide compound in Elara's spice pantry, planted among her vanilla beans.

chapters.title: A Recipe for Framing
chapters.summary: Elara is the prime suspect. To clear her name, she must use her forensic skills to prove the poison wasn't in her food, but she's barred from the official investigation.
key_events: Elara is formally questioned and her kitchen is sealed.
She uses her connections to get a copy of the preliminary autopsy report.
The report confirms cyanide, but the time of death suggests it was ingested after the formal dinner.
Elara discovers a half-finished nightcap glass in Margot's room, missing from the evidence log.
She learns Margot had a secret late-night meeting scheduled.
chapters.ending_hook: A threatening note is slipped under Elara's door: "Stop digging. Some recipes are best left secret."

chapters.title: Bitter Harvest
chapters.summary: Elara investigates the local organic farm that supplies her berries, finding its owner terrified and the fields suspiciously pristine.
key_events: Elara visits Bramble Hill Farm, run by the reclusive Owen.
Owen reveals Margot was blackmailing him over his use of illegal pesticides years ago.
He admits to arguing with her the day she died.
Elara finds a hidden stash of cyanide-based pesticide in a locked shed.
Owen flees when confronted, deepening his suspicion.
chapters.ending_hook: Returning to the inn, Elara finds her herb garden vandalized, with poisonous foxglove planted among her thyme.

chapters.title: The Memoir's Missing Chapters
chapters.summary: Elara tracks down Margot's beleaguered assistant, Leo, to learn the full scope of the tell-all memoir and who it threatened.
key_events: Leo shares encrypted files from Margot's memoir draft.
The chapters expose a town-wide scheme involving fake maple syrup grading, corrupt land deals, and stolen recipes.
Key targets include the mayor, the sheriff's brother, and the town's beloved bakery owner.
Leo reveals Margot had a final, explosive chapter on a decades-old unsolved death.
He admits he hated Margot but was too afraid of her to act.
chapters.ending_hook: Leo is found unconscious in his rental car, having nearly succumbed to carbon monoxide poisoning—a staged 'accident.'

chapters.title: A Taste of Corruption
chapters.summary: Elara follows the memoir's clues to the heart of the fake maple syrup operation, confronting the charming but ruthless mayor.
key_events: Elara poses as a buyer to tour the mayor's 'artisanal' syrup plant.
She uses her palate to identify cheap industrial syrup being passed off as premium Grade A.
The mayor catches her and subtly threatens her inn's upcoming health inspection.
She learns the sheriff is financially tied to the operation through his brother.
A fire breaks out at the syrup plant's records office that night.
chapters.ending_hook: Amid the ashes, Elara finds a melted but distinctive button from a sheriff's deputy uniform.

chapters.title: Proof in the Pudding
chapters.summary: Elara conducts a dangerous experiment to prove her food wasn't the murder weapon, recreating the fatal meal for a risky taste test.
key_events: Using her forensic knowledge, she theorizes the cyanide was in a post-dinner amaretto.
She recreates the exact meal and timeline, inviting the skeptical sheriff to observe.
She demonstrates how the bitter almond scent of cyanide would have been masked by the amaretto.
She reveals the missing glass from the crime scene was a specific crystal tumbler from the inn's bar.
Only someone with intimate knowledge of the inn's stock could have used it.
chapters.ending_hook: The inn's bartender, a quiet fixture for years, packs his bags and disappears in the night.

chapters.title: Ghosts in the Kitchen
chapters.summary: The bartender's flight leads Elara to uncover his connection to the old death hinted at in Margot's memoir: a young cook who died in a kitchen fire 20 years prior.
key_events: Research reveals the cook was the bartender's sister, and Margot wrote the first review that ruined the restaurant, leading to its closure.
The fire was ruled an accident, but Margot's chapter suggests it was arson to cover up theft.
Elara finds the original, celebrated recipe book of the burned restaurant hidden in the inn's foundation.
She realizes several town businesses use slightly altered versions of these recipes as their 'signature' dishes.
The entire town's culinary reputation is built on a stolen legacy.
chapters.ending_hook: The sheriff, under pressure, arrests the vanished bartender for the murder, but Elara knows the evidence is too convenient.

chapters.title: A Palate for Poison
chapters.summary: Convinced the bartender is a pawn, Elara identifies the specific, rare cyanide compound used and traces its acquisition.
key_events: The compound is a specialty photography chemical, no longer commonly used.
The town's elderly photographer, who also supplies the bakery with food-grade images, has a stockpile.
The photographer, a gentle soul, breaks down and admits he gave some to the mayor months ago for 'pest control.'
Elara confronts the mayor at a town festival, causing a public scene.
The mayor deflects, producing a receipt showing he donated the chemical to the high school's science lab.
chapters.ending_hook: The beloved chemistry teacher, a pillar of the community, is seen nervously watching the exchange from the crowd.

chapters.title: The Sweetest Alibi
chapters.summary: Elara investigates the chemistry teacher, whose pristine reputation hides a desperate motive connected to the stolen recipes.
key_events: The teacher's late mother was the partner of the cook who died in the fire; the recipes were their joint creation.
Margot's memoir would have exposed her mother's despair and suicide after the theft and her partner's death.
The teacher has a rock-solid alibi for the night of the murder—proctoring the school's overnight astronomy club.
Elara discovers the school's telescope log shows an hour of 'cloud cover' where observations stopped.
The school is a 10-minute drive from the inn.
chapters.ending_hook: The teacher finds Elara in the lab and, with cold calmness, asks if she knows what it's like to have your entire history erased.

chapters.title: A Gathering Storm
chapters.summary: With the town festival reaching its peak, Elara pieces together the final sequence, realizing the murder required two people: one to distract, one to poison.
key_events: Elara re-examines all evidence, seeing how the mayor's access and the teacher's knowledge combined perfectly.
The mayor provided the poison and created a distraction (a fake business call) that drew Margot's assistant away.
The teacher, using her knowledge of chemistry and the inn's layout, administered the poison.
Their goal: protect the town's secret economy and their parents' legacies.
Elara prepares to present her findings to the sheriff, who has been willfully blind.
chapters.ending_hook: A power outage plunges the bustling festival into darkness, and Elara feels a hand clamp over her mouth from behind.

chapters.title: The Final Course
chapters.summary: Elara escapes her captor and turns the town's festival into a confrontation, using the public setting to force the killers' hands.
key_events: Elara breaks free from the mayor, who tried to silence her.
She uses the festival's PA system to address the crowd, outlining the murder plot and the stolen recipe legacy.
The teacher, cornered, confesses to the poisoning but justifies it as justice for her mother.
The mayor tries to flee but is stopped by the sheriff, who finally does his duty.
The bartender is exonerated; his flight was out of fear, not guilt.
chapters.ending_hook: As the mayor is led away, he snarls at Elara, "You've killed the Blueberry Inn. No one will ever come here again."

chapters.title: A New Menu
chapters.summary: In the aftermath, Elara must decide the future of the inn and her place in a town stripped of its illusions.
key_events: Elara, now a local hero, is entrusted with the original recipe book.
She hosts a community dinner, featuring the restored, authentic recipes, giving public credit to their creators.
The town begins the slow process of honest reckoning and renewal.
Leo, Margot's assistant, decides to publish the memoir as a cautionary tale, with Elara's notes ensuring accuracy.
Elara realizes her forensic skills and culinary passion have found their true purpose in her new home.
chapters.ending_hook: A new food critic arrives for a review, and Elara greets them with a smile, handing them a menu that proudly begins: "Recipes with a known, and honest, origin."
